p.note: An update installation cannot change the authentication mode (INTERNAL or SAML_SP). You can only upgrade from an installation in INTERNAL mode to an installation in INTERNAL mode, or an installation in SAML_SP mode to an installation in SAML_SP mode.

section.title: Preparing the Update
section.p: Before you start with the update installation, carry out the following steps:

ol.li:
In the bes-domain and the master-indexer-domain domains, check whether all JMS messages have been processed. They are stored in the bssjms database. For example, check the JMS broker as follows:
For the bes-domain domain:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/mq/bin/imqcmd.exe -b localhost:8076 -u admin query bkr
For the master-indexer-domain domain:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/mq/bin/imqcmd.exe -b localhost:8476 -u admin query bkr
where 8076 or 8476 is the port where the JMS broker is running.
When executing the above command, you need to specify a password. The default password admin is defined in the password.sample file in the <GLASSFISH_HOME>/mq/etc directory. It is set automatically after the installation of GlassFish. You can also call the above command together with this password file, for example for the bes-domain domain:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/mq/bin/imqcmd.exe -b localhost:8076 -u admin query bkr -passfile ../etc/passfile.sample

Set the following environment variable for your current session:
DB_INTERPRETER: The absolute path and name of the psql executable of PostgreSQL. The executable is usually located in the bin subdirectory of the PostgreSQL installation directory.
Example:export DB_INTERPRETER="/opt/PostgreSQL/9.1/bin/psql"

Proceed with updating your installation in the following sequence:
Create a backup of configuration files, the key file for encryption, the bss database, and all customizations you may have made.
Update the database.
Update the master-indexer-domain domain.
Update the bes-domain domain.
Update the BIRT report engine.
Update the command line tool.
Restart the master-indexer-domain and bes-domain domains.
See below for details.

section.title: Backing Up and Updating Configuration Settings

ol.li:
Create a backup of the following configuration files of your existing installation:
configsettings.properties
db.properties
glassfish.properties of both the bes-domain and the indexer-domain domain.
Based on your existing configuration files, adjust the settings in the configuration files for the new release. Specifically pay attention to new and changed settings.

Create a backup of the key file required for the encryption and decryption of service parameters with data type PWD and custom attributes marked for encryption. By default, the file is named key and located in the following directory:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/glassfish/domains/bes-domain/config

Create a backup of the bss database using the standard PostgreSQL commands. The database backup must be compatible with PostgreSQL 9.1.12.
Creating a backup of search index data is not required. The index will be automatically rebuilt when is operational again.

The oscm-portal.war archive contains the properties files for the user interface resources (user interface and email texts, platform objects). Be aware that with a new release or fix, new keys may have been added to the system, others may have been changed or deleted.
Make sure to have a backup of any customizations you may have made.
The oscm-portal-help.war archive contains the online help and FAQ files in English, German, and Japanese. Make sure to have a backup of any customizations to these files.

section.title: Updating the Database
section.p: Proceed with updating the database as follows:

ol.li: Start the bss database.

Update the schema and configuration settings of the bss database by executing the build-db.xml file in <install_pack_dir>/install as follows:
<ANT_HOME>/bin/ant -f build-db.xml updateDatabase
Make sure that Ant runs in a Java 8 runtime environment when calling the build-db.xml file.
Start the master-indexer-domain domain.
Undeploy the search indexer application, oscm-search.

In the JVM Options of the application server:
Set the following settings to false:
-Dorg.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.ENABLE_CLEAR_REFERENCES=false
-Dcom.sun.metro.soap.dump=false
Delete the following setting:
-XX:MaxPermSize
Add the following setting:
-XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
Stop the master-indexer-domain domain.

Check for .glassfishStaleFiles files. If there are any, delete them. The files are located in
<domain>/applications/<application name>/.glassfishStaleFiles
For example:
master-indexer-domain/applications/oscm-search/.glassfishStaleFiles

Delete any existing index directories in the index base of the master-indexer-domain domain:
master-indexer-domain/masterIndexBase/*
Start the master-indexer-domain domain.

li.p: Deploy the search indexer application (oscm-search located in <install_pack_dir>/domains/indexer_domain/applications).

ol.li: Start the bes-domain domain.

Undeploy the following applications:
oscm
oscm-portal
oscm-portal-help
Optionally: Your own branding package .war file, if you have customized the layout of the marketplaces and created your own branding package.

In the JVM Options of the application server:
Set the following settings to false:
-Dorg.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.ENABLE_CLEAR_REFERENCES=false
-Dcom.sun.metro.soap.dump=false
Delete the following setting:
-XX:MaxPermSize
Add the following setting:
-XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
Stop the bes-domain domain.

Check for .glassfishStaleFiles files. If there are any, delete them. The files are located in
<domain>/applications/<application name>/.glassfishStaleFiles
For example:
bes-domain/applications/oscm/.glassfishStaleFiles

Delete any existing index directories in the index base of the bes-domain domain:
bes-domain/slaveIndexBase/*
Start the bes-domain domain.

li.p: Deploy the applications located in <install_pack_dir>/domains/bes_domain/applications in the following sequence:
If you are running in SAML_SP mode, you need to update the WSIT files contained in the oscm.ear archive.
Execute the build-glassfish.xml file in <install_pack_dir>/install as follows:

p.note: It may be required to enclose the -DpatchProps.path=<path> command in double or single quotes depending on the operating system.

li.p: During the execution of the above command, a tmp subdirectory is created in <install_pack_dir>/domains/bes_domain to which the updated oscm.ear archive is saved. Proceed with manually deploying the tmp/oscm.ear archive to the bes-domain domain.

This archive contains the properties files for the user interface resources (user interface and email texts, platform objects). Be aware that with a new release or fix, new keys may have been added to the system, others may have been changed or deleted.

If you have not customized the texts, existing texts in English, German, and Japanese are overwritten by an upgrade. If you have customized these texts, they are not overwritten. Make sure to have a backup of your changes. After having deployed the oscm-portal, check whether existing texts, for example, mail messages have changed as compared to the previous release. You may need to customize the texts again.

This archive contains the online help and FAQ files in English, German, and Japanese. You can customize these resources. When upgrading the system with a fix for this release, make sure to have a backup of any such customizations. Merge the customized files into the oscm-portal-help archive, before deploying it again. Otherwise they will no longer be available after the upgrade.

If you added additional languages to the system, also include the corresponding help and FAQ file structures into the oscm-portal-help archive before deploying it again. Refer to the Operator's Guide for details.

ol.li: Optionally: Your own branding package .war file

section.title: Updating the BIRT Report Engine
section.p: Due to an incompatibility issue in the application server version supported by , the BIRT report engine cannot be deployed on the same application as . Instead, it needs to be deployed on GlassFish Server, version 3, or Apache Tomcat, version 8.
Proceed as follows to optionally update the BIRT report engine:

ol.li: Download the latest version of Eclipse BIRT runtime, for example, from http://www.eclipse.org.

Deploy the birt.war archive located in <install_pack_dir>/domains/bes_domain/applications to a domain on the application server.
Be aware of the following:
The birt.war archive contains the properties files for the labels and texts used in reports. With a new release or fix, new keys may have been added to the system, others may have been changed or deleted.
Existing texts in English, German, and Japanese are overwritten by an upgrade. If you have customized these texts, merge your customizations into the properties files before deploying the birt.war archive. Otherwise they will no longer be available after the upgrade. Refer to the Operator's Guide for details.

Deploy the birt.war archive located in <install_pack_dir>/domains/bes_domain/applications to the domain on the application server.
Be aware of the following:
The birt.war archive contains the properties files for the labels and texts used in reports. With a new release or fix, new keys may have been added to the system, others may have been changed or deleted.
Existing texts in English, German, and Japanese are overwritten by an upgrade. If you have customized these texts, merge your customizations into the properties files before deploying the birt.war archive. Otherwise they will no longer be available after the upgrade. Refer to the Operator's Guide for details.

Add the report designs and localized labels to the folder of the birt application on the application server.
The report designs and labels are available in the following archive provided for each release: oscm-reports.zip. Extract the contents of this archive to the root folder of the birt application:
<GLASSFISH3_HOME>/glassfish/domains/<domain>/applications/birt or
<TOMCAT_HOME>/webapps/birt.
<GLASSFISH3_HOME> is the installation directory of GlassFish, version 3. <TOMCAT_HOME> is the installation directory of Apache Tomcat.
Restart birt.

section.title: Updating the Command Line Tool
section.p: The current version of the command line tool is provided in the installation package, oscm-install-pack.zip, as oscm-operatorclient.zip. If you want to use the command line tool with your updated installation, delete and install it again when finished with the update. For details on how to set up the tool, refer to the Operator's Guide.
